level.heading: Other considerations of directors.
level.text: Unless the articles of organization otherwise provide, in considering the best interests of a limited cooperative association, a director of the association in discharging the duties of director, in conjunction with considering the long and short term interest of the association and its patron members, may consider:
The interest of employees, customers, and suppliers of the association;
The interest of the community in which the association operates; and
Other cooperative principles and values that may be applied in the context of the decision.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 29-1001.09 and § 29-1008.18.
